intro: Canthium viridiflorum, commonly known as greenflower cowrie. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its distinctive greenish-yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, often dispersed by wind or animals.
